medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days before admission with weakness, loss of appetite, fatigue, and diarrhea, followed by progressive shortness of breath. On the morning of admission, the patient awoke with dyspnea that worsened when lying flat, accompanied by diaphoresis, nausea, and weakness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ischemic cardiomyopathy, atrial fibrillation, transient ischemic attack, stroke, diver-ticular bleed, appendectomy. Medications included digoxin, ezetimibe, levothyroxine, lisinopril, sotalol, acetylsalicylic acid, fenofibrate, and warfarin.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, stopped smoking 35 years ago, did not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, lived with wife in a wooded suburban community, returned from a winter trip to Florida 3 weeks prior.
